titleStmt.title: Fontaine I. Fox to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2134

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Elizabethtown Ky.
July 7th 1865
Hon Thos. E. Bramlette.
Dear Sir:

Some months ago you appointed me a Notary Public in and for Hardin ^county^ I neglected to have my name sent in to the Legislature for confirmation. I have accepted an agency to collect claims under Crutcher, Brinker & Co of Louisville. and they think it best for me to be Notary Public. Will you have commissioned again as such and this time as there is some hopes of profit in it, I will ask to have my name sent in to the Legislature?

Your Truly
Fontaine I. Fox J

Notary Public
Hardin Co
Fon I. Fox
apptd 12 July 1865
